info.description:
The Custom Object Data (Single-Instance) service enables applications to access and manage single-instance custom objects.

Custom objects are extensions of existing Workday business objects. Example: The Worker object can be extended to include a custom object named Parking Space. If a worker can have only 1 assigned parking space, it is a single-instance custom object. To see the custom object definition in Workday, run the View Custom Object task. You can also run the Custom Object Definitions report  to see all custom object definitions for a business object.
info.title: Custom Object Data (Single-Instance)

tags.name: Custom Objects
tags.description:
Provides the ability to create, update, and delete data for a single-instance  custom object.
The field types vary based on the custom object definition. To understand the required format of a request body when creating or updating a custom object, first call the GET method on a custom object instance created in Workday.

parameters.name: customObjectAlias
parameters.description: The web service alias of the custom object. To determine the web service alias of the custom object definition in Workday, run the View Custom Object task.

post.summary: Create a new, or update an existing instance of a custom object.
post.description:
In the request body, include the extended Workday object ID that the custom object is attached to. To specify the custom object fields, you can use the response data model from calling GET /customObjects/{customObjectAlias}/{ID} on an existing custom object instance. You can also see the custom object definition in the View Custom Object task.

To create a custom object instance for multiple Workday business objects, specify the query parameter bulk=true. In the request body, specify an array containing the custom object instance for each Workday business object ID. 

To update an existing custom object instance, specify the query parameter updateIfExists=true. In the request body, specify the custom fields to update. 

Secured by: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object
Scope: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object.

parameters.name: updateIfExists
parameters.description: If true, updates the custom object instance if it exists. If false, returns an error if the object exists. The default is false. If the object does not exist, a new object is created regardless of this setting.

parameters.name: bulk
parameters.description: If true, creates or updates the specified array of custom object instances in the request body. If false, creates the specified custom object instance (without an array). The default is false.

parameters.name: customObjectRequestBody
parameters.description: The custom object instance to be persisted. If bulk=true, specify a JSON array containing the custom object instances, with a maximum of 100. If bulk=false (default), specify a JSON object.

200.description: Custom object collection created or updated.

parameters.name: customObjectAlias
parameters.description: The web service alias of the custom object. To determine the web service alias of the custom object definition in Workday, run the View Custom Object task.

parameters.name: customObjectID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the extended Workday object instance or the custom object instance.

get.description:
Retrieves the custom object instance with the specified ID. Specify either the extended Workday object ID or the custom object ID. 
Example: Assume that parkingSpaces is the customObjectAlias for the Parking Spaces custom object, and 12345 is the Workday ID of the worker with the parking space. To get the Parking Space instance for that worker, call GET /customObjects/parkingSpaces/12345.

Secured by: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object
Scope: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

put.description:
Updates an existing custom object instance with the specified ID. Specify either the extended Workday object ID or the custom object ID. 
Example: Assume that parkingSpaces is the customObjectAlias for the Parking Spaces custom object, and 12345 is the Workday ID of the worker with the parking space. To update the Parking Space instance for that worker, call PUT /customObjects/parkingSpaces/12345. Include the fields you want to update in the request body.

Secured by: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object
Scope: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object.

parameters.name: customObjectRequestBody
parameters.description: The custom object fields to be updated.

delete.description:
Deletes an existing custom object instance with the specified ID.  Specify either the extended Workday object ID or the custom object ID.
Secured by: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object
Scope: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object.

customObjectInstance.description: Contains the extended business object instance and custom object fields.

customObjectFields.description: Contains the custom fields of the custom object.

instance.description: The Workday business object instance ID.
